mods.abstract: Runaway in Jail. A negro boy, who calls himself Alexander and says that he belongs to Edward Fuseilier, a resident of Prairie Plaisance, was lodged in the Parish Jail, at Opelousas, on WEDNESDAY, the 2nd inst. He is about 5 feet 6 inches high 40 years old, black color, and speaks nothing but French. Whe brought to Jail he had an iron collar with three prongs around his neck. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property and take him away, or he will be dealt with according to law. RENE RAULIN, Jailor. Opelousas, Oct. 5 1861.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
